summary: Fruit flies (Drosophila melanogaster) and humans exhibit immune system dysfunction in space . Studies examining their immune systems’
Drosophila larvae and pupae serve as hosts to more than 60 species of parasitic wasps . The developing parasitoid (or parasite) eats the host as both continue to develop .

In 20–25 days, one adult wasp emerges per fly pupa; male and female wasps mate as free-living adults, and females then deposit eggs into fly larvae to initiate another generation . EVs, on the other hand, lyse lamellocytes within a few hours after infection .

Study shows parasites can develop normally in space, retaining their infection strategies . Continued analysis of such systems will be important to help establish multigenerational studies and obtain a fine-grained understanding of the long-term effects of space on diverse organisms .

The average numbers of adult male (A), adult female (B), and all adult (C) flies per vial in naive y w and .hop cultures are shown below . The number of animals, averaged from 14 vials, is shown below.
RNA-Seq analysis of white-eyed w1118 flies on SpaceX-14 mission showed 6.49% and 3.25% DEGs in S0 versus G0 female and male fly heads . On Earth, the .hop strain showed 9.69% of DEGs
Figure 3: Differential expression of Top DEGs in S0/G0 adult flies . Most genes in panel A that maintain differential expression in space are Toll pathway target genes .

These comparative RNA-Seq results suggest matrisome genes of many multigene families that encode proteins of the Drosophila cuticle are sensitive to spaceflight . The space environment had a profound effect on the differential expression of these genes .
S0 y w. sensitive to spaceflight than .hopTum-l flies . 22 DEGs that were significantly downregulated in S0 . w. flies were significantly more likely to have relevance to human conditions .
Differentially expressed immune signaling genes in S0/G0 adult flies . Spaceflight activated the expression of a majority of these immune genes in <em>y w' flies .

The progeny of 300 females and 150 adult males were raised either in the ISS or at KSC (see <a href="#sec4" class="usa-link">STAR methods) at 22°C, and then at 25°C . The weighted average tumor numbers per animal in G0/S0 adults were 1.07 ± 0.22 and 2.94

Previous studies have shown that Lb17 attack provokes stronger cellular immune reactions than Lh14. Lh14-infected larvae instead develop small melanized specks (not recruited into the melanized tumors)

Hemocytes in the lymph gland actively divide and differentiate in the absence of infection . A normal lymph gland has multiple, paired lobes, consisting of hemocytes . The anterior-most lobes are the largest, with hemocytes at varying differentiation stages .
The venom fluid containing the EVs is injected into the host during oviposition . Less than 1.5% of all transcripts identified showed significant change when compared to ground controls .

The identities of the proteins constituting EV proteins were recently published . A majority of the EV transcripts were identified in our RNA-Seq analysis (312/316 for <em>Lb17/em> EV and 398/406 for Lh14/em . 28 of these genes were downregulated; 28 were down regulated . In rare cases, this mutation was incompletely penetrant . To our knowledge, these are the only live mutant animals in this class of wasps .

In 1967, Biosatellite II carried a small ectoparasite that attacks moths . The Bios Satellite II mission reported multiple effects of spaceflight alone, or that of radiation in conjunction with spaceflight, on D. melanogaster .
A plethora of target genes of both the JAK-STAT and Toll pathways is constitutively active in hopTum-l mutants .

Many of the same pathway components and target genes that are constitutively active in hopTum-l mutants are also upregulated in S0 .y w flies, suggesting that the increased tumor burden is fueled by ectopic JAK-STAT and Toll signaling induced in space . Parasites have varied life histories and distinct survival strategies in the context of host physiology . Preimaginal stages remain protected from the environmental challenges

With increased travel to space, it is inevitable that parasites will unintentionally hitch a ride with their hosts . With plans for the colonization of other planets, multigenerational experiments on “short life cycle” organisms such as <em>D. melanogaster will become important .

Version D of NASA GeneLab’s bioinformatics pipeline, available on GitHub, was used to process <em>Drosophila's RNA-Seq reads . A DOI is listed in the <a href="#sec4.1" class="usa-link">key resources table .

The SpaceX-14 mission to the ISS was launched on April 2nd, 2018 . Fly-only cultures were reared in polystyrene vials containing fly food . Fly/wasp co-cultures were set up simultaneously by adding flies to vials for three days . Fly food volume accommodated the respective life histories of the two insect species .  Weather-related issues delayed the original mission time from 31 days to 34 days . The ISS crew installed the samples into the Columbus Module endcone with the CTB lid open . Temperature and humidity data in each VFB were collected throughout the flight mission .
instar larvae were used per hemocyte smear for each replicate . Three biological replicates were performed . Samples were incubated with rabbit anti-phospho-histone H
The Mann-Whitney U test for unpaired samples was made using the Mann- Whitney test . Sample samples were flash-frozen in dry ice and stored at −80°C .

Bulk RNA-Seq analysis was performed on RNA prepared from four replicates of (a) ground control (G0) and space-flown (S0) adult flies; (b) G0 and S0 adult wasps; and (c) G1 and S1 larvae . Larval RNA was isolated from G1 & S1 larval RNA isolated from   Raw fastq files of adult fly RNA-Seq reads from Genewiz were transferred to GeneLab . FastQC (version 0.11.9) was used to generate MultiQC reports . STAR and RSEM references were built using STAR (version 2.7.8a) and RS EM (version 1.3.1) and Ensembl release 101
The magnitude of log (2)-FC for these genes, in both directions, ranged from ∼3- to 12-fold . Of these 1,024 genes, 137 were differentially expressed in at least one of four comparisons .

PSSMs were analysed using R (version 4.1.1) using log (2)-transformed count data from unnormalized and normalized counts . PCA plots were generated for each set of count data using ggplot2 (version 3.3.5) Volcano plots were created using EnhancedVolcano (version 1.12.0) with an adjusted p value

The filters were clamped between O-rings and immersed in ice-cold distilled water . They were then rinsed in distilled water five times, 3min for each rinse . Dehydrated and dried samples were mounted on aluminum SEM specimen mount stubs (Electron Microscopy Sciences) using conductive carbon adhesive tabs . Samples on the filter were coated with gold/p

Over 1,000 male progeny of the four expected genotypes were scored . Ovipositors of 10 wild type and 30 homozygous <em>kona were gently pulled out using sharp forceps, briefly dipped in 70% ethanol and PBS, fixed in 4% paraformaldehyde, and washed in PBS, before mounting in Vectashield .

Sample size, experimental replication, and data analysis of results are also described in the corresponding sections above and/or the corresponding figure legend .
